result.execSummary:
The defendant David M. Schreindl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Marathon County Clerk of Circuit Court

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David M. Schreindl

records.addlTxt:
Case Called: 11:25 am
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Davis Runde in person:
Defendant appears in person, pro se;
VRCW. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. State moves to:
Ct. 1 (BJ-Felony)>>DRI.
Amend Count 2 pursuant to Count 2 (Disorderly Conduct-Domestic Abuse) pursuant to 947.01(1)- 968.075(1)(a).
COURT GRANTS ABOVE.

PLEA: 
Ct. 2 (Disorderly Conduct-Domestic Abuse)>>  NO CONTEST.
Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

COURT ORDERS: 
Ct. 2 (Disorderly Conduct-Domestic Abuse)>> $50 Fine plus Court Costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge and Domestic Abuse Surcharge.
Defendant has 30 Days to pay amount in full and if unable to do so, Defendant to set up a Payment Plan with the Clerk of Court's Office.

Adjourned: 11:33 am
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 16, 2022 at 11:10 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 2, 2022 at 01:50 pm.
Pre-trial conference on May 12, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

Case Called: 3:01 pm
INCLUDES 22CF31 & 22CF391.
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Davis Runde in person and ADA Sid Brubacher in person. Defendant appears in person, pro se.
ADA Brubacher makes statements.
Defendant has completed the work as stated;
State moves to Dismiss 22CF31- COURT Grants State's Motion to Dismiss 22CF31.

Parties are to schedule a future date on the 22CF391 file;
Court advises the Defendant of his right to counsel.

DATES:
PTC with JA 05/12/2022 @ 2:45 pm

Adjourned: 3:03 pm

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: No contact with victim(s): K.S.S.; Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed. Prints and photograph. Report to ATTIC Correctional Services within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 1 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

Clerk: Nikki. 
Case Called: 2:35pm.
State appears by ADA Hannah Boeck. Defendant appears via Zoom, in custody, and with Atty Chad Shamali.
VCRW.
Reading Waived. Reserve Jurisdiction.
Court questions defendant re: complaint and rights.
Prelim Time Limits Waived.
PLEA: NOT GUILTY.

Atty Shamali notes SPD will not be representing deft.

BOND:
$500.00 signature bond.

CONDITIONS:
-No contact with victim(s): K.S.S.
-Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.
-Prints and photograph.
-Report to ATTIC Correctional Services within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 1 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

DATES:
RH: 4/25 @2:50pm., Branch 1.

Adjourned: 2:39pm.
